newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Cyprus stocks decline at end of week.
newsitem.headline: Cyprus stocks decline at end of week.

text.p: Cyprus shares retreated slightly at the end of the week, losing 1.02 percent in subdued trading which brought a decline in all major sub indices.
The 41-share Cyprus Stock Exchange (CSE) general index, set at 100 points, closed at 83.94, down from 84.80 last Friday.
No major changes were recorded in the shares of banking stocks, which represent the bulk of transactions on the exchange.
The banking sub index closed at 92.93 from 93.99 last week, losing 1.06 points.

"As soon as investors gain five percent on their (banking) investments they will look to something else, probably trading companies," said Stavros Agrotis of CISCO, the Cyprus Investment and Securities Corporation.

Banking stocks shot up by two percent between October 28 and November 1 after the Bank of Cyprus announced a successful international convertible bond issue of 40 million pounds on the Luxembourg stock exchange.
An anticipated convertible bond issue of 15 million pounds by the Cyprus Popular Bank in January is expected to add to the momentum of the market, traders said.

The Bank of Cyprus closed at 348.5, down six cents from last Friday's close of 354.5. Fully paid shares in the Cyprus Popular Bank closed at 334.5, down half a cent from 335 last week. Fully paid shares of Hellenic Bank lost 4.5 cents to close at 267.5.
Shares in the Universal Savings Bank closed at 134.5 from 136 last week.
In the trading sector, Woolworth (Cyprus) closed at 96.5 from 100.5 last week. Associate company Zako closed at 96 cents from 98.5 last week.
Winery and brewery Keo Ltd closed at 111.5, up from last week's close and year low of 105 after announcing losses before tax of 393,000 pounds in the first half of the year.
The sub index of the insurance sector closed at 60.58, registering a fall of 2.48 percent from 62.12 last week.

Universal Life Insurance UNII.CY closed unchanged at 379. Paneuropean Insurance fully paid closed down seven cents from last week to 136. Fully paid shares of Interamerican Insurance closed at 106, down 1.5 cents on last week's close of 107.5.

National carrier Cyprus Airways, which on Tuesday reported losses of 2.9 million pounds in its half yearly results, closed at 40.5 from 42 cents last week. This week the company saw its share price sink even lower to 39.5 cents, a year low.
The nominal price of its shares is 50 cents.
